title: ✚ Visualization Tools, Datasets, and Resources — February 2025 Roundup
description: Here are tools you can use, data to play with, and resources to learn from that bubbled up in February.Tags: roundup
author: Nathan Yau
excerpt: Here are tools you can use, data to play with, and resources to learn from that bubbled up in February.
text: This is the Process, the newsletter for FlowingData members on how we visualize data in a useful way. Every month, I collect tools and resources that might help in your data work. Here is the good stuff for February 2025. To access this issue of The Process, you must be a member. (If you are already a member, log in here.) The Process is a weekly newsletter on how visualization tools, rules, and guidelines work in practice. I publish every Thursday. Get it in your inbox or read it on FlowingData. You also gain unlimited access to hundreds of hours worth of step-by-step visualization courses and tutorials, which will help you make sense of data for insight and presentation. Resources include source code and datasets so that you can more easily apply what you learn in your own work. Your support keeps the rest of FlowingData open and assures the data keeps flowing freely.
html:
This is the Process, the newsletter for FlowingData members on how we visualize data in a useful way. Every month, I collect tools and resources that might help in your data work. Here is the good stuff for February 2025.

To access this issue of The Process, you must be a member. (If you are already a member, log in here.)

The Process is a weekly newsletter on how visualization tools, rules, and guidelines work in practice. I publish every Thursday. Get it in your inbox or read it on FlowingData.

You also gain unlimited access to hundreds of hours worth of step-by-step visualization courses and tutorials, which will help you make sense of data for insight and presentation. Resources include source code and datasets so that you can more easily apply what you learn in your own work.

Your support keeps the rest of FlowingData open and assures the data keeps flowing freely.
